title: Screen Freezing after patch 7.1
body:
My game loads in fine but I constantly am having to alt tab out of league to unfreeze it. Don't tell me to alt enter cuz that just makes my screen very small and unplayable. This is really annoying and I want an answer from riot. Are they even trying to fix this? Everyone all over the forums is having this issue.
PLEASE{{champion:17}}

replies.body: I'm having the same problem, but I'm using a PC with windows 10 that runs league at 120-140 fps. My screen freezes a few times each game and I can not switch to other apps (im stuck on league) and i have to wait it out (also i hear all the sounds n stuff)
haven't play it since Wednesday and the only solution Riot gave us was alt+enter, which makes the game suck.
Can you describe the freezing in a bit more detail so I'll have a better idea of what's going on?
screen glitches... sound keep playing and you can still press qwer and it responds... but the screen does not change... you have to alt tab to refresh
exactly my problem! I keep dying due to this problem and I continuously get reported for "feeding."

Are you using a new Macbook with the touch bar, as others have mentioned here? Also, does this happen if you enter a match from the Legacy Client, which you can access from the login screen?

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Let me know!

Yes, new MacBook Pro with touchbar. and yes it happens if I enter from the legacy client. I uninstalled league and reinstalled it, and did not upgrade to alpha client. It works much better now but still freezes occasionally. Hopefully there will be a fix from apple or riot soon?

Gotcha. The steps that *DragoniteDD* mentioned in this thread have been known to resolve the performance issues with these new Macbook pros for some players, so I really recommend giving them a go. I've provided a quote of the steps below:

>**You'll want to log into the game and leave it running in the background. Then complete the following:**
- Select your 'Applications' folder on your Dock
- Select 'Open in Finder'
- Right Click on 'League of Legends'
- Select 'Show Package Contents'
- Select 'Contents'
- Select 'LoL'
- Delete the folder named 'Config' (Right Click, then select 'Move to trash', then empty your trash)

In addition to the steps above, you may also want to [**temporarily disable the Hot Corners feature**](http://osxdaily.com/2016/08/10/disable-hot-corners-mac/) in macOS. This feature has exacerbated performance issues on newer Macbooks and caused some erratic mouse movements for some players.

Let me know if this made any improvement for you!
No I've tried this several times, and I don't use hot corners. I just get reported for dying when I'm not even in the game

If you're still seeing issues, then it may be a good idea to escalate this to our tech team. I recommend running a set of system logs using our [**HRT App**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach the zipped logs to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so a tech can get back to you.

If you run into issues with this, let me know.
I am using windows and I am having the same problems.

hey I am using the new MacBook Pro with new client, exactly same issue as described above, pls help.
what's your machine? New MacBook Pro with touch bar??? I have the same issue on my 15 touch bar MacBook Pro

It seems all users with the freeze (0 FPS all of a sudden, with all other functions continue normally) issue are new macbook pro (touch bar) models.

FYI
Here is a possible solution from a RIOT customer support staff:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You'll want to log into the game and leave it running in the background. Then complete the following:
Select your 'Applications' folder on your Dock
Select 'Open in Finder'
Right Click on 'League of Legends'
Select 'Show Package Contents'
Select 'Contents'
Select 'LoL'
Delete the folder named 'Config' (Right Click, then select 'Move to trash', then empty your trash)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
reference: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/25074438?page=1

I just played a smooth AI game, will do more tests later to see if it actually solves the problem. At least it worth a try for you guys.

Awesome, thanks for the heads-up about this!

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

The situation is like that the FPS is suddenly 0. Game sounds are still going on and the cursor is not frozen and you can give commands to your champion. (you will be able to hear it but not see it since the screen is frozen)

A temporary solution is to cmd+tab to switch to other apps and then switch back to LoL game window to temporarily fix it, but it might occur again sooner or later.

Borderless Mode or Window Mode won't have the issue, but the game is extremely laggy (screen is laggy, not the network, ping is fine, fps is much lower than full screen mode, but the screen is yet much laggier than what the fps should indicate. for e.g. a 70fps will be as laggy as 20~30fps) in those two modes and almost not possible to play.

It happens on my new retina MacBook Pro 15 inch with touch bar since 7.1, but fine on my friends' old MacBook Pro machines.

I think the cause is that something modified from 6.24 to 7.1 is not compatible with some unique features of the new MacBook Pros. Just FYI

Three friends of mine and I had a similar issue of freezing in a ranked game  however it happened to us all at the SAME time. We tried  alt-tabing, trying to bring up the task manager, and etc, did not resolve the issue. We were able to fix the issue by restarting our pc's but unfortunately we lost because the enemy team was able gain a huge lead in the time we were not in game. We are split between 2 cites in the same province and we have different ISPs so I really doubt its our internet connection, just wondering if someone from Riot or in this thread could give a reasonable explanation as to why this issue coincidentally happened to all of us at the same time. Thanks.
try to run your game with Video > Resolution: Borderless
